authors: Carlos Rivas; Claudia Verónica Reyes Guzmán; Keila Herrera Rivas; E. Márquez; Ricardo Riguera Vega; Juan Miguel Kosztura Nuñez
abstract: espanolSe evaluo la fotodegradacion del insecticida Diclorvos utilizando oxido de titanio modificado con butiraldehido usando radiacion ultravioleta como fuente de energia. La modificacion de la superficie del catalizador por el butiraldehido se ajusto a la isoterma de Lang-muir. La caracterizacion de los catalizadores se realizo utilizando las tecnicas de espectroscopia UV-Visible por reflectancia difusa y espectroscopia infrarrojo por reflectancia total atenuada. Se evidencio la formacion de un enlace acetal y disminucion de la energia de la banda gap. La degradacion del insecticida se evaluo a tres condiciones de pH (3, 7 y 10) variando la concentracion inicial del sustrato. El catalizador TiO2-butiraldehido fue mas eficiente en la degradacion del Diclorvos en comparacion con el compuesto TiO2 sin modificar, obteniendo el mayor valor de la constante de degradacion a pH 10. Este comportamiento se justifica por el aumento en la cantidad de radicales hidroxilos (•OH) en el medio alcalino, favoreciendo el proceso catalitico al disminuir el tiempo de vida media de la reaccion (32,7 minutos) y aumentar el porcentaje de degradacion del insecticida (93,76%). La modificacion de la superficie del semiconductor favorecio el proceso de fotocatalisis heterogenea para el Diclorvos. catalaEs va avaluar la fotodegradacio de l’insecticida Diclor-vos utilitzant oxid de titani modificat amb butiraldehid usant radiacio ultraviolada com a font d’energia. La modificacio de la superficie del catalitzador pel butiraldehid es va ajustar a la isoterma de Langmuir. La caracteritzacio dels catalitzadors es va realitzar utilitzant les tecniques d’espectroscopia UV-Visible per reflectancia difusa i espectroscopia infraroig per reflectancia total atenuada. Es va evidenciar la formacio d’un enllac acetal i disminucio de l’energia de la banda gap. La degradacio de l’insecticida es va avaluar en tres condicions de pH (3, 7 i 10) variant la concentracio inicial del substrat. El catalitzador TiO2-Butiraldehid va ser mes eficient en la degradacio del Diclorvos en comparacio amb el compost TiO2 sense modificar, obtenint el major valor de la constant de degradacio a pH 10. Aquest compor-tament es justifica per l’augment en la quantitat de radicals hidroxils (•OH) en el medi alcali, afavorint el proces catalitic en disminuir el temps de vida mitjana de la reaccio (32,7 minuts) i augmentar el percentatge de degradacio de l’insecticida (93,76%). La modificacio de la superficie del semiconductor va afavorir el proces de fotocatalisi heterogenia per el Diclorvos EnglishPhotodegradation of the dichlorvos insecticide was evaluated using titanium oxide modified with Bu-tiraldehyde using ultraviolet radiation as a source of energy. The modification of the catalyst surface by the Butiraldehyde was adjusted to the Langmuir isotherm. The characterization of the catalysts was performed using the techniques of UV-Visible spectroscopy by diffuse reflectance and infrared spectroscopy by at-tenuated total reflectance. The formation of an acetal bond and decrease in the energy of the gap band was evident. Insecticide degradation was evaluated at three pH conditions (3, 7 and 10) by varying the initial concentration of the substrate. The TiO2-butyraldehyde catalyst was more efficient in the degradation of dichlorvos compared to the unmodified TiO2 compound, obtaining the highest value of the degradation constant at pH 10. This behavior is justified by the increase in the amount of hydroxyl radicals (•OH) in the alkaline medium, favoring the catalytic process by decreasing the half-life of the reaction (32.7 minutes) and increasing the percentage of insecticide degradation (93.76%). The modification of the semiconductor surface favored the process of heterogeneous photocatalysis for dichlorvos

abstract: Starting with acetylurea derivatives, the triazine, thiazine, uracil and condensed uracil systems were synthesized. This was achieved through diazotization, reaction with carbon disulphide or carbonyl compounds followed by a cyclization step.

title: Corrosion and Dezincification Controll of alpha-Brasses by Chromate ions in Acetic-Acetate Solutions
authors: N. A. Al-Moubarak; H. H. Rehan; H.A. Alrafai
abstract: The corrosion and dezincification behaviours of α-brasses (Zn%: 33, 34, 37) in acetic-acetate solutions, pH 2.4-8.5, in the absence and presence of chromate ions was studied by weight loss, solution analysis and electrochemical polarization. Chromate ions were found to act either as corrosion accelerators or as inhibitors, depending on pH, alloy composition and chromate concentration. Chromate suppressed efficiently the corrosion and dezincification at pH 7.0 and 8.5. The presence of chromate in acidic solutions (pH 2.4) was found to increase the corrosion rate at the beginning (one hour) but inhibition action prevailed after sufficient time (one week). The alloys did not suffer dezincification in the absence or presence of chromate at pH 2.4. The corrosion acceleration action of chromate at pH 2.4 was explained in terms of cathodic reduction of the prevailing dichromate ions. At pH 7.0 and 8.5, chromate inhibited the anodic dissolution of copper and, more efficiently, zinc in alloy, leading to suppression of dezincification and corrosion. The inhibition action of chromate in neutral and slightly alkaline solutions is assumed to occur via chemisorption of chromate species and improvement of passivity of the corroding alloys as well.

title: Kinetics of Oxidation of some meta- and para- substituted phenols by N-chloropiperazine-2,5-dione in non-aqueous medium: A LFER Study
authors: A. N. Palaniappan; S. K. Srinivasan; S. Senthilkumar
abstract: The kinetics of oxidation of substituted phenols by N-chloropiperazine-2,5-dione (NCPD) have been studied in methanol medium. The order of the reaction is found to be one with respect to the oxidant, the order with respect to substrate varies depending on the nature of the substituent present in the ring and fraction with respect to the hydrogen ion concentration. Decrease in percentage of methanol slightly increases the rate of the reaction. Increase in ionic strength has no significant effect. The reaction does not induce the polymerization of acrylonitrile. Isokinetic plot gives a straight line with fine correlation coefficient. But the Hammett plot gives a curve that is concave downwards, instead of a straight line. The observed Hammett plot deviation has been accounted for suitably. The reactions are carried out at four different temperatures and the activation parameters have been calculated.

title: Corrosión crateriforme del aluminio en las soluciones acuosas de los aminoácidos

title: Reactions with Coumarin VIII
authors: Ibrahim Zeid; I. Imam Ismail; A. H. A. El-Aleem; Abdelaziz Ebead
abstract: A series of thiadiazole and selenadiazole derivatives was synthesized via oxidative cyclization of some semicarbazone derivatives of the types 3 and 6. The later compounds were formed via reaction of coumarin-6-sulphonyl chloride 1 with m-, p-aminoacetophnone and/or o- and p-hydroxyacetophenone to give coumarin-6-sulphonamides 2 or the esters 5. Condensation of 2 and 5 with semicarbazide hydrochloride afforded the semicarbazones 3 and 6. Oxidative cyclization of 3 and 6 with thionyl chloride led to the formation of the thiadiazole derivatives 4 and 7. On the other hand, oxidative cyclization of 3 and 6 with selenium dioxide led to the formation of selenadiazole derivatives 8 and 9.

title: Efecto de los parámetros de dispersión en la separación de aceite de agua residual: aplicación en columnas de flotación
authors: Francisco José Trigo Tavera; Ramiro Escudero García
abstract: Wastewaters of the Oil Company Tron Hnos. S. A. from C. V. (Morelia, Mich. Mexico) contain vegetable oils (corn, ajonjoli, soya, heliotrope), in proportions between 40% and 50% v/v, that form stable emulsions with theaqueous phase. In this work, the results of the experimental study about the separation of wastewater oils by flotation in laboratory columns are presented. The results of this research show that the recuperation of the organic compounds is 60% v/v in only one flotation stage; but considering series of 2, 3, and 4 columns, oil recuperations increase towards 90%, 95% and 97% v/v, respectively. The experiments showed that there is a lineal correlation between flotation kinetics and the parameters that determine the straggling effect. Besides, this study suggests that there is an optimum size of the bubbles, where oil recuperations are highest. This works shows that the application of flotation columns for oils separation in water is becoming very important.

title: Performance of Activated Sludge System in Aerating Sugar Processing Wastewater
authors: N. El Ibiari; S. Hawash; G. El Diwani; H. Elabd
abstract: The Aerobic biological treatment of food processing wastewaters is associated with poor sludge settling (bulking), and this has been largely linked to the high soluble organic component in these wastewaters, high chemical oxygen demand and high C: N: P ratios. Strategies to minimize sludge bulking in activated sludge systems or sequencing batch reactors has been identified and includes the design and operation of these systems under extended aeration conditions for wastewater effluent in a sweet and gum factory. The major focus of this paper is the effectiveness of the sludge bulking control methods and problems throughout this case study are also presented.

title: El apoyo de la Unión Europea a las Pyme. Oportunidades de financiación de proyectos de I+D
authors: R. Solozábal

title: Mathematical modeling of pollution dispersion by a point source-Eulerian method
authors: M. Nikazar; N. Maleki; Kh. Badii
abstract: In present paper, Eulerian model is applied to a point source at mesoscale region. The data that has been collected from Neka power station (in north of IRAN) was used to check the validity of model. S02 was the pollutant that was measured in this experimental data. The reactions of SO 2 were ignored, because the life-time of its is more than a day and our application is in short range transport. The Eulerian model, in its complicated form, has been solved by various numerical methods and compared the results.

title: Síntesis de sorbitol a partir de sacarosa usando extractos de Zymomonas mobilis CP4 con actividad de sacarosa y glucosa-fructosa oxidorreductasa
authors: J. N. Hiriarte; S. Bravo; C. Shene
abstract: Sorbitol synthesis using the extract of Zymomonas mobilis CP4 cells and sacharose as substrate was studied. In these extracts, the specific activities of glucose-fructose oxidoreductase, responsible enzym for sorbitol synthesis, and sacharase were of 0.73 and 1.81 U/mg of protein, respectively. Sacharose solutions with initial concentrations of 100 and 200 g/L were incubated at 30 °C and pH 6 with 116.8 units of glucose-fructose oxidoreductase and 289.6 units of sacharase. After 25 hours of incubation, conversions of 57 and 43% of substrate in sorbitol were obtained, respectively. During the process, the levana, branched polymer of fructose, represents less than the 10% of the initial substrate. The formation of this secondary product is due to the activity of the levansacharase of the celular extract.

title: Beneficio del mineral de hierro barítico egipcio mediante procesos físicos para obtener un concentrado dual
authors: Fatma H. Abd El-Rahiem
abstract: In the El-Gedida iron ore deposits there is a block of about 30 million tons neglected because of its high sulphur content in the form of barite and silica gangue minerals. From this bulk two concentrates of high grade iron concentrate (-68% Fe, total sulphur 0.41% and silica 0.314%) and high grade barite (64.15% BaO, 0.129% Fe and 1.31% silica with recovery 74.58%) are obtained by magnetic separation and shaking table.

title: Capas de cobre no electrolíticas : propiedades físicas y composición del baño
authors: Enrique Julve Salvadó
abstract: Printed circuit boards can be fabricated economically using electrodes catalysed copper plating. A new electroless plating bath is presented. This aqueous bath contains copper sulphate, EDTA, formaldehyde, triethanolamine, glycine and sodium hydroxide. Copper deposits obtained are crack-free, show very good adhesion and range from 5 to 11 percent in elongation and from 30-60 Kg/mm 2 in tensile strength. Copper layers of good quality are obtained controlling specially the formaldehyde concentration, which governs the plating rate. Mechanism of catalysed reactions and structure of electroless copper layers are given.

title: Síntesis de interés biológico de los derivados del ácido 5- y 8-aminoquinolina-3-carboxílico 1-sustituido
authors: Svatava Smrčková-Voltrová; Petr Vašek

title: Estudio preliminar sobre la determinaciÓn de compuestos orgánicos volátiles y semivolátiles en efluentes de tenería mediante cromatografía de gases acoplada a espectrometría de masas
authors: M.C. Riva; Héctor Daniel González
abstract: Tannery effluent samples have been analyzed in order to discover their most significant pollutants and quantify them whenever posssible. The analysis of Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) and Semivolatile Organic Compounds(SVOCs) have been carried out by Gas Chromatography using Mass Spectrometry detection. After the analysis of effluents from different processses, the results that have been obtained show the presence of certain amounts of different compounds. While some of them come from the water used in the factory that provided the samples, some others have their origin in the products used in the different processes and in the ones added to leather as a conservative.

title: Solvent effect on the photoreduction of trans-[Co(tn)~2Cl~2]Cl in aquo-organic solvent media
authors: Kuppanagounder P. Elango; G. Vijayakumar
abstract: The photoreduction of trans-[Co(tn) 2 Cl 2 ] + ion has been studied using a low pressure mercury vapour lamp as light source (254 nm) in aquo-organic solvents [0-30% (v/v) Methanol or 1,4-dioxane]. Quantum yields for Co production by redox decomposition have been determined, and increases considerably with the increase in concentration of methanol or 1,4-dioxane in the binary solvent mixtures under investigation. A plot of log(quantum yield) versus the Grunwald-Winstein parameter, solvent ionizing power, Y, shows that a different blend of general and specific solvent interacts with the solute. This kind of non-specific and specific solvent interaction on the reactant/excited state has been quantified and analysed using multiple regression: viz. Krygowski-Fawcett and Kamlet-Taft equations.

title: Estudios comparativos sobre las propiedades catalíticas de los óxidos metálicos de plata, niquel y zinc
authors: Asem A. Atia; Nagi R.E. Radwan; Ahmed M. Donia
abstract: Single, double and triple oxides of silver, nickel and zinc were prepared at different calcination temperatures. The obtained phases were identified using X-ray technique. The catalytic properties of the oxides were investigated by studying the decomposition of hydrogen peroxide. The double oxide Ag 2 NiO 2 found to have the highest catalytic activity over pure NiO, Ag 2 O or ZnO. The activity of the double oxide was decreased on adding zinc to the phase. The activity for all systems studied was interpreted on the basis of the theory of catalytically active sites. The catalytic activity dependent on the concentration of the active sites and not on its nature. The active sites were energetically comparable although it is different in nature.

title: Síntesis de algunos derivados nuevos del tiouracilo con una actividad biológica esperada
authors: O. A. Fathalla

title: Análisis mediante TLC/FID de extractos de lanolina recuperados a partir de baños de lavado industrial de lana
authors: Cristina Domínguez; Francisco Soler Garde; Josep M. Bayona; P. Erra
abstract: Lanolin, from wool wax or grease, is a natural product secreted by sheeps, which covers wool fibres to protect them from external agents. This is the reason why we find it dispersed in wool industrial washing baths, and it can be partially recovered by centrifugation. In order to control the efficacy of scouring process and the lanolin recovery, its content is periodically estimated in scouring baths. The most conventional method is based on the liquid-liquid extraction (ELL), using carbon tetrachloride and isopropyl alcohol. Recently, an alternative method has been studied, the extraction in a solid phase (EFS), which avoids the use of chloride solvents. In this work, it is carried out the qualitative and quantitative analysis of the different families of lipid compounds that can be found in the different fractions of lanolin obtained by the new method of extraction in solid phase (EFS). Thin layer chromatography technique coupled to a flame ionisation detector (TLC/FID) have been used for that purpose. The results are compared with the ones obtained with the conventional ELL method.

title: The 1-Furoyl-3-Ciclohexyl Thiourea As Ionophore Mercury (II) Ion Selective Electrode. Twice Nernstian Response
authors: Otazo Sánchez; Elena María
abstract: With 1-Furoyl-3-Ciclohexylthiourea as neutral mobile carrier, a selective liquid membrane electrode to mercury (II) was developed. The PVC membrane was deposited dropwise directly into a composite graphite- epoxy support.The sensor exhibits a Twice Nernstian response for both pH: The experimental slope at pH = 7.0 was 59.15 ′ 1.38 mV per decade and the experimental slope at pH = 4 was 29.66 mV per decade. The ISE minimum lifetime is 10 weeks, with a response time of 27 s. The ISE showed a good selectivity for mercury, The selectivity coefficients Kpot were obtained by four method. Only one interference for Ag + was found.

title: Oxidación del dimetilsulfóxido con un hidroperóxido. Aislamiento y caracterización del intermediario de la reacción paroxídica

title: Catálisis iÓnica en la TermÓlisis unimolecular del DiperÓxido cíclico de acetona (ACDP) estudiada por espectrometría UV
authors: Nelly L. Jorge; J. M. Romero; María G. Castellanos; Laura Leiva; Manuel E. Gómez Vara; Lázaro F. R. Cafferata
abstract: The thermal decomposition reaction of 3,3,6,6-tetra-methyl-1,2,4,5-tetroxane (ACDP), was examined in methanol solution (3,7 x 10 - 7 M) with the addition of cupric ions in the 130.0°-166.0 °C temperature range. The ion-catalyzed reaction follows pseudo first-order kinetic laws respect to the peroxide and the metallic ions added. The corresponding Arrhenius equations represent the temperature effect on the thermal decomposition reactions of ACDP and allow to evaluate quantitatively its stability in the solutions. The activation parameters values of the initial step of the ACDP reactions (ΔH' = 21.8 ′ 0.5 kcal/mol; ΔS = -10.8 ′ 0.8 Cal/mot K; ΔG' = 26.3 ′ 0.5 kcal/mol and ΔH' = 22.3 ′ 0.7 kcat/mol; ΔS' = -10.8 ′ 1.0 cal/mol K; ΔG' = 26.8 ′ 0.7 kcal/mol, using gas chromatography and UV spectroscopy as analytical methods, respectively, support coordination processes which involve the metallic ion and the peroxide molecule. It is suggested that the thermal d composition reaction of ACDP molecule Is favoured by removing its orbital symmetry restrictions or by compelling a diminished electronegativity of the oxygen atom involved in the unimolecular reaction.

title: Kinetics studies on oxidation of mandelic acid by chromium (VI) catalyzed by Mn(II)
authors: Niranjan Nalwaya; S. L. Bikaneria; B. L. Hiran
abstract: Chromic acid oxidation of mandelic acid is catalyzed when [Mn(II)]/[Cr(VI)] ratio is more than 95. Below this ratio retardation of rate by Mn(II) is observed. Contrary to the observations of Sengupta and Chatterjee [Z. Physic. Chem., 75 (1971) 15], the rate of oxidation of mandelic acid is catalyzed by the addition of manganous ions. The products of catalyzed reaction are benzal d ehyde and CO 2 . This Is due to oxidative decarboxylation of Mn(III)-mandelic acid complex followed by C-C bond fission in rate-determining step. Rate Is first order with respect to [Cr(VI)] and [Mn(II)]. Reactions involve free radicals and obey Michadelis-Menten type kinetics. Formation of Mn(II)-mandelic acid complex is suggested. Cr(VI) acts as one electron transfer oxidant.

title: Legislación Española y Comunitaria, publicada en el B.O.E. y en el D.O.C.E., de enero a marzo de 2001

title: Síntesis de las 4-[(E)-2-furil)metiliden]-1-(ptoluensulfonilformamido)-1,2,3,4-tetrahidro-3-piridazinonas y de los 2-(p-toluensulfonilamino)-5-[ aracil- -(2-futril)]-(E)-vinil-1,3,4-oxadiazoles
authors: Abdel‐Sattar S. Hamad Elgazwy; Ahmed I. Hashem
abstract: Formation of 4-[(E)-2-furyl)methylidene]-1-(p-toluene-sulfonylformamido)-1,2,3,4-tetrahydro-3-pyridazinones 4a-d from the interaction of α-aracyl (β-2-furyl)acrylic acid hydrazides 2a-d with tosylisocyanate. It has been shown to occur by initial formation of N 1 [α-aracyl-β-(2-furyl)acroyl-N 2 [-(p-toluenesulfonylamino]methanoyl hydrazines 3a-d (isolated as intermediate), followed by ring closure of compounds 3a-d using acid catalyzed cyclisation to provide 2-tosylamino-5-[α-aracyl-β-(E)-2-furyl)]vinyl-1,3,4-Oxadiazoles 5a-d which have been isolated and characterized spectroscopically.

authors: D. B. Sánchez de Rojas

title: Procedimiento para la síntesis de ACE-inhibidores
authors: Alberto Palomo Coll; Sonia Serra Morte

title: Determinación secuencial de metales en suelos utilizando espectrometría de absorción atómica y nebulización no convencional
authors: Sheyla Alleyne; Carlos de la Fé Nápoles; Isel Cortés Nodarse
abstract: According to their reactivity and chemical affinity, metals are distributed among soils and sediments components. Many analytical procedures had been described for quantitative determination of metals in such samples. Theapplication of a procedure previously described by Tessier et. al. (Anal. Chem., 51 (7), 844-851, (1979)) for measuring Ni, Cd, Cu and Zn in a cuban soil sample is presented. It was modified changing all the extracted fractions into nitric acid matrix. Final quantification was performed by a non-conventional nebulization system and flame atomic absorption spectrometry. More than the 50% of the total amount of each element can be determined with the proposed procedure. Results were compared with HF/HCIO4 digestion of the sample, considered as a total digestion.

title: Aplicación de modelos multimediales al estudio de un episodio de derrame de petróleo en la costa del Río de la Plata (Argentina)
authors: P. J. Peruzzo; A. Porta
abstract: As a consequence of the increase of oil production, transport and refining in Argentine in the last decade, the number of accidents caused by the transport of this product and its subsequent release to the environment has increased remarkably. This study evaluates the distribution of 5000 m 3 of Hydra crude in the environmental compartments, using the multimedia pattern called «Level I», which incorporates data from the involved area and the physicochemical properties of the spilled hydrocarbon. The results obtained from the application of Level I in the range of the working hypothesis and the adjustment of the pattern to the characteristics of the affected area were contrasted with field data and it resulted an appropriate description of the distribution for the selected tracers and an objective contribution which allowed the assignation of the respective responsibilities of the protagonists of the analysed accident.

title: Ethylene reaction at high temperatures on HZSM-5
authors: C. J. L. Rico; Ryuichiro Ohnishi; Masaru Ichikawa
abstract: The catalytic cracking of ethylene was investigated at 973 K and 873 K, at atmospheric pressure and in presence of a weakly dehydroxylated (WD), or strongly dehydroxylated (SD), HZSM-5. At 873 K the catalytic activity of the WD sample is very small, whereas the one for the SD sample is significant However, at 973 K a significant amount of ethane was produced by the SD sample, whereas benzene was the main product for the WD zeolite. A very rich and wide hydrocarbon product distribution was observed for the WD sample and its catalytic activity was stable, even after a long time on stream. A difference in product selectivity for the two catalysts was also observed. Since the surface areas of both catalysts strongly decreased during reaction, due to the formation of carbonaceous species, whose catalytic activity is still significant, it demonstrates that those species play an active role on the ethylene reaction, probably acting as a proton source. The catalysts were also characterised by BET, XRD, SEM and by an Induction Furnace. Our results also show that the carbonaceous species formed on both spent catalysts are amorphous in nature, the carbon content is high and the morphology is different.

title: Utilización de amilasas para la optimización del proceso de desintegración

title: 2 3-dicyano-1,4-naphthoquinone as a dienophile in Diels-Alder reactions
authors: A. S. HAMMAM; M. A. HASSAN; Ragab F. Fancy
abstract: The Diels-Alder reactions of 2,3-dicyano-1,4-naphthoquinone 1 with 1,3-pentadiene, 2-methylbutadiene, 2,3-dimethylbutadiene, 2,5-dimethyl-2,4-hexadiene, cyclopentadiene, 1,3-cyclohexadiene and anthracene are described. Diels-Alder reactions of 2,3-dichloro-5,6-dicyano-1,4-benzoquinone (DDQ) with anthracene and 1,3-cyclohexadiene were also investigated.

title: Dispersed phase holdup and slip velocity in reciprocating plate column
authors: Alfredo Ismael Curbelo Garnica; Márcia Duarte; Gretel Villanueva Ramos; Carlson Pereira de Souza; F. Curbelo
abstract: A comprehensive study of the influence of the level agitation, phases superficial velocities, hole diameter and plate spacing on dispersed phase holdup and slip velocity in reciprocating plate columns with 5 cm internal diameter and 120 cm of the active length of column is presented. The experimental data show the influence of these variables on the dispersed phase holdup and slip velocity. The dispersed phase holdup decreases when increase in plate spacing and hole diameter, and increases when agitation level and phases superficial velocities are increased. Empirical correlations for the holdup and slip velocity are proposed by using the experimental data (360 point).

title: Conversión del octano sobre zeolitas ZSM-5 cargads de metal
authors: A.K. El-Morsi; S.A. Shokry
abstract: The yields of aromatic hydrocarbons in the transformation of n-Octane over ZSM-5 zeolites are greatly enhanced by interaction of cations (Co, Co-Ni and Ni-Mo) into the zeolites, Effect of temperature on the product distribution over Co/ZSM-5, Co-Ni/ZSM-5 and Ni-Mo/ZSM-5 catalysts were examined in order to obtain information on the reaction pathway. Reaction temperature ranged between 350-500 °C and W/F = 15g catalyst/g.mole of nC 8 /h, and H 2 /nC 8 of 5:1 (mole / mole). When temperature is low, aromatization of n-Octane prevails using Co/ZSM-5 catalyst and when the temperature is extended, cracking proceeds. Aromatization of n-Octane proceeds much more at higher temperatures on using Ni-Mo/ZSM-5 catalyst, n-Octane aromatization gives maximum value at 400 °C. Co-Ni/ZSM-5 catalyst has the lowest conversion for the production of aromatics between these catalysts under investigation.

title: Aplicación de los modificadores químicos en la determinación de elementos de Cromio, vanadio y Titanio en muestras de aguas residuales mediante espectrometría de absorción atómica en horno de grafito
authors: S. H. Abdel-Halim
abstract: A method is described for the determination of Chromium, Vanadium and Titanium in waste water samples by graphite-furnace atomic absorption spectrometry (GFAAS). There are serious depressing interferences in the direct determination of Cr, V and Ti elements in waste water samples by GFAAS. Using Citric acid, EDTA and Ascorbic acid as chemical modifiers. However these interferences could be eliminated in the determination of Cr, V and Ti, respectively. The success of the method is verified by comparing the results obtained by ICP-atomic emission spectrometry (ICP-AES) using standard addition method. The reliability of the method has been demonstrated by the spiked recoveries of analyte of interest to waste water samples.

title: Oxidation of alpha-amino acids by KMnO4- MnSO4in sulphuric acid medium: A kinetic & mechanism study
authors: Niranjan Nalwaya; Kallash Chand; B. L. Hiran
abstract: Oxidation of glycine, valine, leucine, iso-leucine and phenylalanine by KMnO 4 -MnSO 4 in sulphuric acid medium has been studied. Active oxidizing species involved is Mn(OH) 2 + . During reaction Mn(IV) is also formed in small quantity which affects the rate. Free radical mechanism has been suggested which is consistent with the observed entropy of activation. Effect of concentration of KMnO 4 , H 2 SO 4 , HClO 4 , Mn(II), sodium pyrophosphate and ionic strength has been investigated. Thermodynamic parameters have been evaluated. Energy of activation ranges between 72.20 to 91.54 kJ mol - 1 and entropy of activation is negative and low. A cyclic complex formation, which undergoes C-C fission, has been suggested. The order of rate of reaction is phenylalanine > glycine > iso-leucine > leucine > valine.

title: Del espectro al color: simulación informática del color de una disolución
authors: Jordi Cuadros; Mónica Martínez Huerta; José Javier Molins Vara; Xavier Tomás Morer

title: Estudio de la morfología del refuerzo en materiales compuestos de polímero. AplicaciÓn al poliéster insaturado modificado de impacto con partículas de un copolímero de butadieno-acrilonitrilo
authors: Portal WiWi-Portal English Pages; Francisco Carrasco‐Marín; T. Lacorte; X. Colom; Francisco Javier Cañavate
abstract: This work refers to the morphological characterization of reinforcing elastomer particles of a butadiene-acrilonitrile copolymer (VTBN), once they have been dispersed in different proportions (2.4 to 23.1% in weight) in unsaturated polyester matrices (UP). The interest of the study is based on the fact that the main mechanical characteristics of the compound VTBN/UP depend on the size, density and morphology of the reinforcing particles. The experimental technique consisted of processing different optical microphotographs by usin an image analyzer, and this has enabled to make a series of statistical calculations in order to characterize the reinforcing particles morphology. These values have been compared with the values obtained through quantitative metallography. it has been sohwn the dependence betweden particle size and the proportion reinforcing elastomer/matrix. the content has also Influenced the percent of area occupied by the elastomer particles. It has been also estimated that maximum reinforcing proportion was 16.7% in weight, because for upper values there was a phase inversion.

title: Tratamientos de los efluentes de la fabricación de pastas celulósicas para papel. Breve revisión bibliográfica
authors: Fernando C. Ortíz; I. Pérez; María E. Eugenio; Erika Jhohana Cortés Navarro; Lilia Carpio-Jiménez
abstract: This work consists of a literature review about the different treatments applied to the effluents from the factories of cellulose pastes for paper. Different types of treatments (closure of biological, chemical circuits, etc..).of the effluents of several bleaching processes (DED, ECF, TCF, enzimatic, etc..) applied to different types of pastes (kraft pulp, sulfite pulp..) from soft and hard woods are considered. The objective is to exhibit the necessity of reducing the environmental spills as well as their toxicity.

title: Efecto de la distribuciÓn de agua de lavado en el mezclado en columnas de flotaciÓn
authors: Francisco José Trigo Tavera; Ramiro Escudero García
abstract: It has been speculated about the role of different operating parameters on the mixing in column flotation. This communication presents the results of gas holdup measurements as a function of wash water distribution in a laboratory flotation column. The flotation column was operated with vertical baffles, as well as without baffles. The experimental results are unanimous in presenting that the position of the wash water feed affects directly the behaviour of mixing, and in consequence the bubble size distribution, and the gas holdup distribution in the flotation column. A comparison between the laboratory data and industrial observations is done.

title: Studies on the electrochemical behaviour of Al-Ni alloys in alkaline solutions
authors: F. H. Assaf; Mortaga M. Abou‐Krisha; Ayman M. Zaky; F. M. El-Sheikh; E. Maghrapy
abstract: The electrochemical behaviour of Al and Al-Ni alloy of different Ni % content below the eutectic, the eutectic and beyond the eutectic composition were investigated by potentiodynamic anodic polarization and potentiostatic current-time transient techniques in NaOH solutions complemented by metallugraphic examination. The anodic polarization behaviour of both Al and Ni was introduced for comparison. The results of anodic passivation parameters showed that the alloy of the eutectic composition has the highest resistivity against corrosion in all studied solutions. This may be attributed to the decrease of the anodic dissolution rates with increasing surface area ratios of the eutectic composition in the alloy. The main anodic dissolution reaction in all alloys is identified as a selective dissolution of the Al, α-phase, from the Al(α) + NiAl 3 (β) eutectic composition. The corrosion behaviour of the alloys below the eutectic composition is attributed to the bifunctional effect of Ni 2 + cations in the solution, which either promotes or inhibits the dissolution of the alloy, depending on the concentration of Ni 2 + cations dissolved in the solution.

abstract: The reactions of 2-phenyl-4-arylmethylene-2-oxazolin-5-ones (1a-c) and 2-phenyl-4-arylazo-2-oxazolin-5-ones (4a,b) with 1,4-dihydro-5-imino-3-methyl-1,4-diphenyl-pyrazolo[4',3':5,6]pyrano[2,3-d]pyrimidine-6(5H)-amine(2) give the corresponding imidazolone derivatives (3a-c) and (5a,b) respectively.Also the reactions of (1a-c) and (4a,b) with diazo compounds (6a-c) were studied in different conditions.

title: Predicting Dispersion Characteristics in Flotation Columns from the Physical Characteristics of Rigid Spargers
authors: Ramiro Escudero García; Francisco José Trigo Tavera; C.O. Gómez; J.A. Finch
abstract: Rigid spargers are gaining renewed interest in some flotation column applications such as de-inking of recycled paper, de-oiling of water, and recovery of metallic ions from hydrometallurgical solutions. Sparger selectiondepends in these cases on the characteristics of the sparger (material and geometry), the stream to be processed (% solids, presence of surfactants), and on the dimensions of the column. There is no method to predict bubble size or gas holdup (or bubble surface area flux) for a combination of sparger, column and stream. The prediction is difficult because there are two processes involved: the formation of a bubble swarm at the sparger and the rise of the swarm against a countercurrent flow of pulp or water. A method is proposed to predict gas holdup by a combination of two models: one for bubble formation at the sparger which relates bubble size to sparger and stream characteristics; and the second for bubble flow which relates bubble size to gas holdup and phase hydrodynamics. The application of the method is illustrated for a set of spargers made of porous stainless steel installed In a column which was run with water and frother.

title: EvaluaciÓn de anodos de aluminio mediante los procedimientos DNV RP B401 y NACE TM190-98
authors: Arce Zavala; I. Puente; C. Rodríguez; Juan Genescá Llongueras
abstract: Testing of indium activated, aluminium alloy, galvanic anodes currently used in cathodic protection of steel structures immersed in sea water has been carried out using the procedures of two recommended practices, DNV RP B401 and NACE TM 190-98. These accelerated electrochemical tests are useful to obtain information about its electrochemical behaviour and corrosion characteristics, and are principally intended to serve as QA/QC indicator purposes regarding the electrochemical faradic efficiency during manufacturing process, helping as a criterion for the acceptance or rejection of a lot of anodes. Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy (EIS) as a non-destructive and in-situ electrochemical technique has allowed to demonstrate the evidence of passivation as well as localised corrosion (pitting) during evaluation on the samples tested.

title: Synthesis of new quinoxaline derivatives
authors: Hayam H. Sayed; Fatma Bassyouni; I. Imam Ismail
abstract: The sugar hydrazones 4a-c were produced via reactions of the acid hydrazide 3 with arabinose, mannose and glucose, respectively. The triazolylderivative 6 was formed via the reactions of 3 with methylisothiocyanate yielding the thiosemicarbazide derivatives 5b followed by cyclization with NaOH solution. Reaction of 3 with phenylisothiocyanate afforded 5a. Reaction of 3 with CS2 and KOH gave either the oxadiazolyl derivative 7 or the potassium thiocarbazate 8 depending on the reaction conditions. Fusion of 8 with hydrazine hydrate gave the 1,2,4-triazolyl derivative 9. The 1,2,4-triazoloquinoxalines 13, 15, 16 and 18 were synthesized through the reactions of 2-hydrazinoquinoxaline 11 with CS 2 , ethyl chloroformate, formic acid and p-chlorobenzaldehyde. Ethyl chloroacetate reacted with 11 to give the triazinoquinoxaline 20 via the intermediate 19.

title: Tandem Diels-Alder Cycloaddition/Rearrangement: a Method for the Synthesis of a 2,5,6-Trisubstituted Biphenyl
authors: Alberto Avenoza; Jesús H. Busto; Carlos Cativiela; Jesús M. Peregrina
abstract: This article describes the synthesis of a 2,5,6-trisubstituted biphenyl, an analogue of paracetamol and methyl salicylate, by tandem Diels-Alder reaction/1,3-rearrangement. The procedure involves the Diels-Alder cycloaddition of (Z)-2-phenyl-4-benzylidene-5(4H)-oxazolone with Danishefsky's diene, followed by a 1,3-rearrangement of the methoxycarbonyl group in the corresponding cycloadduct to give a 1,4-cyclohexadiene derivative, which could be straightforwardly transformed into the biphenyl system by aromatisation.

title: Influencia del pH y de la temperatura en la hidrólisis de celobiosa con celulasas de T. reesei
authors: V. Bravo Rodríguez; Montserrat Dueñas; Antonia Reyes Requena; M. Aoulad El‐Hadj

title: Tratamiento de efluentes provenientes de la industria de tableros prensados mediante lodos activados a escala piloto
authors: Cristian Bornhardt; M.C. Díez; Emilio Vergara; Luis Doyhamberry; Alejandro Valdes
abstract: The results obtained correspond to a pilot plant of active sludge to two stages that has been working for three years in the treatment of effuents in the industry of pressed boards. Although it is possible to remove more than 90% of soluble organic matter, the defective sludge deposition and also operating problems caused by wood toxical components make this process inadvisable.

title: Síntesis y caracterización de membranas de polisulfona para ultrafiltración de carbohidratos
authors: Georgina Díaz; José Abramo Marchese; Nelio Ariel Ochoa; Aldo Saavedra
abstract: In this work, the results of the synthesis and characterisation of ultrafiltration membranes made on polysulphone are exposed. The membranes were synthesised using the phase inversion technique, changing the polymer and additive concentrations and considering different wet thickness of the moulding, in order to establish the effect of those variables of manufacture on the permeoselective properties of the membranes. The characterisation of every membrane permeability was done with the mesurement of water and gases flows with regard to the pressure applied, whereas the selectivity determination took place by means of the splitting of polysaccharides aqueous solutions. An increase in the polymer concentration caused simultaneously a decrease in the permeability and an increasse in the molecular cut. An increase in the additive concentration represented an increasse in the permeability and a reduction in the molecular cut. Finally, the increase of wet thickness caused a reduction of the permeability and the molecular cut. The obtained results showed the feasibility to manufacture membranes with predefined permeoselective characteristics, from an appropriate selection of the indicated variables.

title: Kinetic studies on the oxidation of furfural by quinolinium fluorochromate
authors: K. Sekar
abstract: The kinetics of oxidation of furfural by quinolinium fluorochromate has been studied in 60% acetic acid-water medium. The order of the reaction is found to be one with respect to oxidant and substrate. The order with respect to hydrogen ion concentration is two. The rate of oxidation increases with increase in the percentage of acetic acid and increase in ionic strength has negligible effect on the rate. The reaction does not induce the polymerization of acrylonitrile. The retardation of the rate by the addition of Mn 2 + ions confirms that a two electron transfer process is involved in the reaction. The reaction rates have been determined at different temperatures and the activation parameters calculated and a suitable mechanism has been proposed.

title: Extracción organosolvolítica de lignina a partir de cáscaras de almendra hidrolizadas en condiciones suaves
authors: Francisco Javier López-Cremades; Jorge Quesada; Mario Trejo Rubio
abstract: The organosolvolytical removal took place with solvent mixtures of ethanol/water and dioxane/water and without the use of acid catalysators, of the lignin contained in a solid waste from a xylose production process from kernel shells. It was studied the influence of solvent/water ratio, removal time and temperature on the delignification and on the process selectivity. The use of ethanol/water and dioxane/water mixtures with a 75/25 (v/v) composition and a removal temperature of 210 °C lead to high delignification values (> 75%) for a removal time of 40 min in case of ethanol and of 25 min in case of dioxane, with a good delignification selectivity (> 70%). Nevertheless, from all studied variables, removal time showed minimum influence on lignin elimination process.

title: Electrostatic versus Covalent Immobilization of Bis (Oxazoline) Complexes
authors: M. Isabel Burguete; José I. Garcı́a; José M. Fraile
abstract: Two bis(oxazoline)-copper complexes are immobilized by electrostatic interactions, using two different methods and two different anionic supports, and by covalent bonding to a homopolymer. The catalysts thus obtained are compared in the benchmark cyclopropanation reaction of styrene with ethyl diazoacetate. Whereas for the bis(oxazoline) bearing phenyl groups anionic immobilization is the more advantageous strategy, homopolymer formation is better for the tent-butyl-substituted bis(oxazoline). The choice of the immobilization method depends therefore on the structure of the chiral ligand, the strength of copper complexation being identified as an important factor. Modification of the substitution of the central methylene bridge of the bis(oxazoline) is also relevant with regard to the cis/trans and the enantioselectivities.

title: Recuperación de complejos cianurados a partir de efluentes industriales de procesos Merrill Crowe mediante resinas intercambiadoras aniónicas
authors: Marcela González; René Maurelia; Dante Ledezma García
abstract: The extraction and stripping of free cyanide and Fe, Zn, Cu cyano complexes from a waste solution of a Merrill Crowe process was studied. Anion exchange resins Amberlitre IRA 958, Amberlite IRA 900 and Amberlite 400 beads, packed in columns were used. The best extracting resin was Amberlite IRA 958 with a maximun loading capacity of 180 mg NaCN/ g of dry resin. Cyano complexes extraction was quantitative and inicial free cyanide was reduced to a 31%.

title: Synthesis of some glycosides of pyridinone derivatives
authors: Hosam A. Saad; M. N. Mokbil; A. M. EL‐GENDY; A. Z. Haikal
abstract: Synthesis of 3-cyano-4,6-dimethylpyridin-2-one ribosides, glucosides or galactosides is described, as well as 3-cyano-6-methylpyridin-2-one ribosides, glucosides and galactosides.

title: Safe start-up of semi-batch process with exothermic reactions
authors: Miquel Angel Alós; Isel Grau; Josep A. Feliu
abstract: This contribution proposes a strategy for the safe start-up of semi-batch process according to the inherent safety principles. The approach is based on the calculation of a target temperature deduced from the mass and heat balance equations of an ideal Semi-Batch Reactor and correcting actions over the cooling fluid temperature and feed rate. A nitration process that has underlined a potential risk of thermal runaway has been selected as a case study for showing the application of the proposed strategy. The chemical reactions involved in such a process as well as the industrial plant operating conditions and safety characteristic process parameters are presented. A rigorous simulation of the process using HYSYS has showed that applying such strategy to the case study allows keeping the process in the safest possible conditions. The method only requires measurements that are usually available in industrial plants and basic safety process parameters but kinetic models are not required.

title: Study of kinetics and diffusion of heavy alkylate hydroconversion on mordenite catalysts
authors: A.K. El-Morsi; F. I. Kenawi; R.A. El‐Adly; R. HABIB
abstract: The hydroconversion of heavy alkylate is carried out using catalysts containing mordenite: HM (10), HM (20), HM (40), HM (60), pt / HM (10), pt/HM (20), pt/HM (40), Cu/HM (40), Mo/HM(40) and Cr/HM(40). A kinetic model wasdeveloped for heavy alkylate hydroconversion over these catalysts . Hydroconversion rates were temperature sensitive in the range of 673 K -748 K, energies of activation and effectiveness diffussive parameters were calculated.

title: Trace metal evaluation in wet precipitation in the surroundings of A Coruña
authors: R. M. Soto-Ferreiro; J. M. Andrade-Garda; Purificación López‐Mahía; Soledad Muniategui‐Lorenzo; D. Prada-Rodrı́guez
abstract: The analysis of wet precipitation provides useful information about the aerosol composition, in particular of trace metals. In this work, a simple rain sampler was utilized and the results obtanined for Cd, Cu, Mn, Ni, Pb, V and Zn in rain samples of the city of A Coruna are presented. A multivariate (Factorial Analysis) study was performed in order to relate the results obtained with the main contamination sources of the considered area as well as with the atmospheric conditions during the sampling period. In this way, several types of samples were characterized taking into account the wind direction and the rain events.

title: Estudio y comparación de dos técnicas de oxidación avanzada en el tratamiento de efluentes contaminados
authors: Josu Sanz Alonso; José Ignacio Lombraña; Ana de Luis; Fernando Varona; M. Ortueta
abstract: The main objetive fof this work is the comparative study of two oxidation techniques in the treatment of industrial aqueous effluents which use H 2 O 2 as oxidizing agent. First of all, the technique known as of the Fentonreagent, widely described, and secondly the technique that uses microwave irradiation, an innovative technique, used as a generator agent of oxidizing radicals in the treatment of contaminated effluents. Each technique has been applied to aqueous effluents with different levels of charge: on one had to effluents with low charge like standard phenol solution and on the other hand to effluents with high charge, like waste waters of a detergent production plant. The comparative study of both systems has been realised by means of a factorial design of the reaction conditions: pH, oxidizing concentration and catalyst concentration or irradiation time with MW; the expressions obtained allow an estimation of the substrate removal in relation with the studied variables.

title: THE EFFECT OF CALCINATION TEMPERATURE ON THE ACTIVITY AND CERTAIN PHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES OF WATER-GAS SHIFT REACTION CATALYSTS
authors: Morteza Sohrabi; Akbar Irandoukht
abstract: e effect of calcination temperature on the activity and some properties of low temperature water gas shift reaction catalysts has been studied. It has been found that the catalysts' surface area decreased with increase incalcination temperature. The presence of an amorphous CuO phase within the structure of some catalysts has been related to the desirable conditions prevailed during the synthesis of the latter. The copper crystallite particle size has been observed to increase with temperature. The activities of catalysts have been determined using a fixed bed catalytic reactor. It has been observed that the catalyst's activities were normally enhanced with increase in temperature and pressure of the reaction systems.

title: Efecto de algunas variables en la flotación de fosfatos sedimentarios
authors: F. Hernáinz Bermúdez de Castro; M. Calero; G. Blázquez; J.M Espinosa Espinosa
abstract: It has been carried out an study about the influence of some variables in the flotation of precipitated phosphates, using sodium oleate as collector agent. It has been analyzed the effect of the pH in the flotation bath, the concentration of the collector agent and the variation of bath temperature. The obtained results indicate that an increase in the temperature raises considerably the mineral recuperation percentage, and the result is that those percentages are higher as higher is the employed oleate concentration. At the same time, this increase in the bath temperature increases the richness in P 2 O 5 of the flotated mineral.

title: Heteroacoplamientos catalizados por paladio
authors: David Sánchez‐García; Salvador Borrós; Santi Nonell; José I. Borrell; Caries Colominas; Jordi Teixidó
abstract: In the last ten years palladium's chemistry has been thoroughly applied in organic chemistry due to its versatility and its great selectivity. In this short review we present the general features of the catalytic cycles involved in heterocoupling reactions illustrated by the Kumada, Negishi, Stille, Suzuki, Heck and Sonogashira reactions.

title: Activated carbons from coconut shell by chemical activation. A first approach to a quantitative relation between textural parameters and preparation conditions
authors: Moisés Huertemendia Marin
abstract: High surface area activated carbons were prepared by chemical activation of coconut shell from the canned fruit industry with phosphoric acid as activating agent. The influence of activation parameters namely acid concentration for impregnation, the way of eliminating the impregnating acid and the heating rate on the characteristics of the materials obtained was studied by means of a two level experimental factorial design. The textural properties of the samples are analyzed by N 2 adsorption at 77 K and CO 2 adsorption at 273 K and by immersion microcalorimetry employing dichloromethane as molecular probe. The BET equation was applied to N2 adsorption isotherm data to determine the surface area. The Dubinin-Radushkevich equation was applied to CO 2 and N 2 adsorption isotherms to obtain the micropore volume Vo. The micropore surface area corresponding to the microcalorimetric experiments was determined by comparing the heat evolved in the immersion of this substance in the analyzed sample with that corresponding to a reference material of a known area (6.986 J/g corresponds to 62 m 2 /g . BET specific surface areas as high as 1500 m 2 /g were obtained and values in the same order for micropore areas determined by microcalorimetric measurements. The mathematical relation between the preparation conditions and the BET surface area through a first-degree polynomial expression is discussed as well as its connection with other textural parameters.

title: Influencia de la solubilidad del soluto gaseoso en la absorción mediante lavadores jet-venturi
authors: Xavier Gamisans Noguera; Montserrat Sarrà i Adroguer; Javier Lafuente
abstract: Systems for gas contaminants removal based on venturi effect (venturi scrubbers) have traditionally been used for the removal of particles from gas effluents. Its application to the reduction of chemical contaminants emission has received less attention. In this work, it is stu- , died the absorption of two gas contaminants, usually found in a great number of industrial plants (ammonia and hydrogen sulphide) using a washer jet-venturi system. With a statistical technique (experiments design accompanied by response surface patterns), the effect of different operative and geometrical variables in the absorption process is studied. The obtained yields were very high for ammonia (75-95%), while for hydrogen sulphide were slightly lower (55-90%). It has been established that jet-venturi system is appropriate for gas solutes which have high solubility in the absorbent solution.

title: Absorción de dióxido de carbono en disoluciones de dietanolamina en isopropanol
authors: J. R. Ventura Perera; Cristóbal García; G. Liminana de la Fe; Michael A. Diaz
abstract: The kinetic of the reaction of carbon dioxide with diethanolamine (DEA) in isopropanol solutions was studied at 298 K using a laboratory wetted-wall contactor. The reaction order respect to the DEA, n, and the apparent kinetic coefficient, k, were determinate by experimental conditions that assured pseudo-1 order regimen. Found values were: n = 1,7 and k = 76 (m 3 /kmol) 1 , 7 s - 1 The reaction was described with the zwitterion-mechanism originally proposed by Caplow and developed by Danckwerts ( 1 2 ) with reaction rate constants of mechanism given by 208,9 m 3 /(kmol.s) for k, and 1,71 kmol/m 3 for k 2 /k 3 .

title: Blanqueo de pasta Kraft de eucalyptus globulus por phanerochaete chrysosporium
authors: Marı́a Teresa Moreira; A. Maceiras; Juan M. Lema; Gumersindo Feijóo
abstract: In this study it has been analysed the influence of manganese and organic acids concentration, in particular of oxalic acid, in the delignification and biobleaching capacity of the basidiomycetes lignicolous fungus, Phanerochaete chrysosporium, on kraft pulp of Eucalyptus globulus, partially delignified with oxygen. The bleaching levels acquired, about an increase of 6-8 ISO units, after the fungus treatment have been equal to the best results obtained previously, in case of stools with a high pulp bleaching capacity. The optimum level of manganese in the medium was of 33 μM of Mn 2 + , although in the absence of manganese, the P. chrysosporium was also efficient to make an extensive pulp delignification. The existence of organic acids was determinant in the activation of the bleaching mechanism, and the use of oxalic acid (in a concentration of 5 mM) did really influence positively on the bleaching results observed. The only extracellular cellulase detected in all the tests was the manganese peroxidase, with activity levels between 5 and 25 U/L.

title: DeterminaciÓn de los índices topolÓgicos de mayor influencia en la estructura molecular de los hidrocarburos acíclicos saturados
authors: Vicente García Espeso; José Javier Molins Vara; Anna Forns Giró; Fèlix Riera Parcerisas
abstract: Several analysis of the main components in the population of alkanes with two to ten atoms of carbon, one hundred and forty nine elements, and ten atoms and seventy five elements are being realised. In the first case, seventy-one topological indexes and in the second case forty-two indexes. The aim of these analysis is to distinguish which indexes provide more information about the structure of this type of compounds.

title: Relación propiedades térmicas - comportamiento electroquímico en aleaciones tipo Finemet-Crx (x = 0,4) con distintas relaciones Si/B
authors: C. Tojal; A.R. Pierna; A. Altube
abstract: In order to improve the corrosion resistance of the FINEMET alloy, compositional changes (crhomium addition and/or Si/B relation variation on the alloy) have been investigated, and their effect on the electrochemical behaviour of as-quenched and nanocrystallized alloys has been measured. Afther the thermal treatment at 600 °C, it is possible to observe the effect of the composition changes on the formation of the nanocrystalline phase and on the migration and diffusion processes of the alloy components. This changes are reflected on the electrochemical behaviour alloys against corrosion. The electrochemical behaviour of the alloy in 0.5N KOH and 2N HCI, has been studied using cyclic voltametry, potentiodynamic polarization and corrosion test techniques. Crystallization states of the studied alloys, have been analyzed by differential scanning calorimetry. In this work, it can be concluded that the silicon provides a good corrosion resistance. This corrosion resistance is still enhances by the nanocrystallization due to the silicon migration towards the nanocrystal and its surface.

title: Regeneración ósea y del cartílago: un nuevo reto para la ciencia de los materiales
authors: Edgar Casajuana Garreta; Tomás-Ramón Fernández; Salvador Borrós; Lon J. Mathias
abstract: Bone and cartilage regeneration is still a challenge in medicine, due to the high complexity of these tissues. Materials science plays an important role in the future of the bone and cartilage restoration research. Its main goal is the development of biomaterials able to promote bone and cartilage healing. This paper gives a general view of the problem and the state of the present research about bone and cartilage regeneration. It also shows the need for the development of a global approach, which bears in mind all the involved parts of the cartilage/bone system, as well as its different organization levels.

title: Aplicación de la técnica de impedancia faradaica (C.A.) en la evaluación de los compuestos furánicos G-0 y su residuo como inhibidores de la corrosión del acero bajo en carbono en disoluciones de HCl
authors: Xiomara Cabrera Bermúdez; Olga Cortijo Jacomino
abstract: Through some research done before on furanic compounds G-0 and their derivates as corrosion inhibitors of low-carbon steel, their high inhibitor efficiency has been reported in diluted solutions of HCI at boiling temperature. It turned out much more to be efficient in the boiling conditions than at room temperature. In this paper the application of the Faradaic impedance technique (AC) is made in the evaluation of G-0 residue as corrosion inhibitor of low carbon steel in contact with HCI 5 % weight solution. The effectiveness of G-0 residue in dilutes HCI solution was proved. Besides it was also corroborated that electrochemical transference processes mainly controls reactions. It was well established that the impedance in the inhibitive solution is higher than the impedance obtained in the non-inhitive solution in the two temperatures studied.

title: Editorial: From 1921 until 2002, 500 issues of AFINIDAD
authors: J. A. Muntadas

title: Influencia de la densidad de pulpa y del tamaño de celda en la flotación de minerales
authors: F. Hernáinz Bermúdez de Castro; M. Calero; G. Blázquez
abstract: A study has been carried out about the effect of the variation of pulp density and flotation cell size with mineral species, pure and separate celestite and calcite, using two collector agents, Aeropromoter-805 and Aeropromoter-801R. A DENVER D-12 flotation machine with four different cell sizes 1,25, 2,5, 5 and 10 L has been used to study the influence of cell size, and that will let us work with mineral masses between tens of grams and several kilograms, depending on previously adopted pulp density. The results found show that either pulp density or cell size do significantly influence on the recuperation percentage of both minerals.

title: Una nueva definición de la matriz de adyacencia que contempla la presencia de heteroátomos del segundo nivel cuántico
authors: Vicente García Espeso; José Javier Molins Vara; Anna Forns Giró; Sergio Domínguez García; Xosé Manuel Rodríguez Cruz
abstract: It is proposed a modification in the definition of the adjacency matrix for trees of ponderated arches and apices, that is, acyclic molecules which contain heteroatoms and consequently, double and triple bonds between them or with carbon atoms. The objective is to assign a weight k not only to multiple bonds but also a weight h to every apex. The values of these parameters are obtained when the characteristic polynomial, and consequently the adjacency matrix, really maintain one property of the Hosoya index.

title: Estudio de la dispersión axial en una columna de platos reciprocantes
authors: Alfredo L. C. Garnica; Márcia Duarte; Gretel Villanueva Ramos; Carlson Pereira de Souza
abstract: Axial dispersion coefficient was measured in a reciprocating plate column with 5 cm internal diameter and 120 cm of active length, using the technique of tracer response in a non-stationary phase. Experiments were realised in water, as continuous phase, and the operation variables studied were: amplitude (0,4 and 6 cm) and reciprocating frecuency (0-1,85 hz), continuous phase superficial velocity (0,15-0,46 cm/s), hole diameters of stainless steel plates (0,3 y 0,8 cm), as well as the spacing among them (5 y 10 cm). The results showed that the axial dipersion coefficient is strongly dependent of amplitude and reciprocating frequency. Coefficient values were from 1 until 16,21 cm 2 /s. In general, the coefficient increased when plates spacing decreased and continuous phase superficial velocity and hole diameters increassed. Experimental data were registered and an empirical correlation was proposed for axial dispersion coefficient.

title: Niveles de nitrato en abastecimientos de agua potable de la ciudad de Olavarría, Argentina
authors: Oscar A. Díaz; Viviana Colasurdo; Eduardo Usunoff
abstract: In this work are summarized the results of the follow up of nitrate levels, corresponding to all the water collectings of the drinking water operation service in the city of Olavarria (Buenos Aires, Argentina), in orderto establish their quality with regard to this parameter and to study the variations produced. The good quality observed with regard to nitrate ion content of these waters is really surprising, because practically all the cities of the province of Buenos Aires are supplied by underground water for human consumption, and high values of nitrate due to anthropic origins are registered. This has obliged the organism in charge of the (private) supply to reorientate its investments towards activities of more economical and social revenue.

title: Introducción a la química combinatoria
authors: Josep Lluís i Falcó; Roberto Pascual; Jordi Teixidó; José Ignacio Borrell Bilbao

title: Matrices e hipermatrices de Hosoya, Hermann-Zinn y Merrifield-Simmons
authors: Vicente García Espeso; José Javier Molins Vara; Fèlix Riera Parcerisas
abstract: It is reviewed the definition of Hosoya matrix and the result given by Randic is the definition of Hosoya hypermatrix. Hermann-Zinn and Merrifield-Simmons matrixes and hypermatrixes are defined and its construction, in case of chains, is examined. The three hypermatrixes are decomposed in two different forms. These decomposition are able to generate new topological indexes which will be used in quantitative relationships structure-property.

title: Modulación del efecto colector de un agente de superficie del tipo alquilsulfosuccinamato por adición de metasilicato sódico
authors: F. Hernáinz Bermúdez de Castro; M. Calero; G. Blázquez
abstract: A study of celestite and calcite minerals by the collector agent tetrasodium N-(1,2-dicarboxiethyl)-N-octadecylsulphosuccinamate has been carried out. In order to regulate the collector action of the agent, sodium metasilicate at a concentration between 10 - 5 and 10 - 2 . The results obtained about pure minerals state that the alkylsulphosuccinamate collector is more specific for celestite than for calcite; meanwhile the values found for different mixtures celestite-calcite show experimental conditions where the separation of both minerals might be considered.

title: Vías para enfrentar la contaminaciÓn por residuales líquidos en la industria azucarera
authors: Zenaida Herrera Rodríguez; Ana M. Contreras Moya; L. Martínez Mederos; Elena Domínguez
abstract: The present paper is about the pollution by wastewater in sugar mill. For the solution it suggests the application of Complex Process Analysis, developing Heuristic Diagrams with general methodologies for this analysis and treatment methods, particularly the physical-chemical treatment of coagulation-flocculation. It's proposed the use of nonconventional chemical agents in the optimal range of concentration and pH applied in a sugar refinery wastewater.

title: La pasta de papel de mercado. Consideraciones
authors: Fernando Sánchez Lafraya
abstract: The efforts realized by the paper and stuff industry with regard to the fight against contamination and deforestation, IPPC and PEFC, FSC, and woodland treatment have been largely discussed. The offer/demand relationshipsin the market paper sector as well as its future evolution and their movements as a consequence of world market evolution have also been commented. Possible future settings for the different market paper stuff, according to their long or short fiber, eucaliptus or acacia nature have been related. Finally, some comments have been made with regard to the evolution of prices and future developments, as well as the influence of dollar/euro relationship.

title: Efecto de la temperatura en la flotación de minerales. (I), Sistema celestina-oleato sódico-silicato sódico
authors: F. Hernáinz Bermúdez de Castro; A. Gálvez Borrego; M. Calero
abstract: espanolSe ha estudiado la influencia de la temperatura en la flotacion de celestina (SrSO,), usando oleato sodico como colector y silicato sodico como depresor, para un tamano de particula comprendido entre 80/100 mallas A.S.T.M. (177-149 um). Los experimentos se han llevado a cabo sobre el mineral puro en un tubo de Hallimond termostatizado a temperaturas comprendidas entre 293 y 323 K. Los resultados obtenidos muestran que silicato sodico ejerce sobre el mineral una accion depresora de mayor o menor intensidad segun la concentracion de oleato sodico y temperatura utilizadas. En este sentido, el efecto depresor del agente disminuye considerablemente al aumentar la concentracion de agente colector y la temperatura del bano de flotacion. catalaEstudi de la influencia de la temperatura sobre la flotacio de la celestina (SrSO,), emprant oleat sodic com a col-lector i silicat sodic com a depressor, pera una grandaria de particula entre 89/100 malles ASTM (177-149 um), portantse a terme els experiments sobre el mineral pur en un tub d'Hallimond termostatitzat a temperatures de 293 i 323 K. Els resultats obtinguts indiquen que el silicat sodic produeix sobre el mineral una accio depressora de major o menor intensitat segons la concentracio d'oleat sodic i la temperatura utilitzades, de forma que l'efecte depressor de l'agent disminueix considerablement a l'augmentar la concentracio de l'agent col-lector i la temperatura del bany de flotacio. Englishlt has been studied the influence of the temperature in the flotation of celestite (SrSQ,), using sodium oleate as collector and sodium silicate as depressant, for a particle size between 80 and 100 A.S.T.M. mesh (177-149 um). The experiments have been carried out on pure mineral, in a thermostatted Hallimond tube, at temperatures between 293 and 323 K. The results obtained show that sodium silicate has a depressant effect on the mineral, of greater or lower intensity, depending on the used sodium oleate concentration and temperature. In this sense, the depressant effect of the agent decreases considerably, when the concentration of the collector agent and the temperature of the flotation bath increase.
